meanings.definition: Clean or polish (a wooden deck or floor) with a block of sandstone or a similar abrasive material.
meanings.sent1: The sailors were holystoning the deck to make it shine.
meanings.sent2: Every week, the crew holystones the wooden deck of the ship.
meanings.sent3: As the sailors joked around, they pretended to holystone the deck with exaggerated movements.
meanings.sent4: The act of holystoning the deck felt like erasing all the dirt and grime of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of holystoning echoed across the ship, creating a sense of order and cleanliness.

meanings.definition: A block of sandstone or a similar abrasive material used for cleaning or polishing wooden decks or floors.
meanings.sent1: The holystoning block was worn smooth from years of use.
meanings.sent2: The sailors stored the holystoning blocks in a special compartment on the ship.
meanings.sent3: During the storm, the holystoning block rolled back and forth comically on the deck.
meanings.sent4: The holystoning block was like a magic eraser for the wooden floors, making them gleam.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the holystoning block in his hand gave the sailor a sense of purpose and duty.
